name: D. X-Magic Pair
statement:
You are given a pair of integers (a, b) and an integer x.You can change
the pair in two different ways: set (assign) a := |a - b|; set (assign)
b := |a - b|, where |a - b| is the absolute difference between a and
b.The pair (a, b) is called x-magic if x is obtainable either as a or as
b using only the given operations (i.e. the pair (a, b) is x-magic if a
= x or b = x after some number of operations applied). You can apply the
operations any number of times (even zero).Your task is to find out if
the pair (a, b) is x-magic or not.You have to answer t independent test
cases.
